content:
On Feb. 4, 2024, a user on X named il Donaldo Trumpo (@PapiTrumpo) – whose account mentions that it posts "a little bit of parody" – posted (archived) a video that appeared to show 14-time Grammy Award-winning recording artist Taylor Swift holding up a flag while walking the red carpet that read, "Trump Won, Democrats Cheated."

While the video may have appeared obviously fake to some users, Elon Musk's social media platform X still showed a label that was displayed under the post that identified it as "manipulated media," adding a link to "find out more" and "stay informed."
The link in the "manipulated media" label led to a policy page on help.twitter.com, which showed that remnants of the old name "Twitter" could still be found on the platform. The page began, "You may not share synthetic, manipulated, or out-of-context media that may deceive or confuse people and lead to harm ('misleading media'). In addition, we may label posts containing misleading media to help people understand their authenticity and to provide additional context."
The original video posted by Variety on Feb. 4 showed Swift simply walking the red carpet and posing for photos, holding no flags or banners of any kind.
Taylor Swift is gorgeous at the #Grammys. https://t.co/Imoq8xlJM9 pic.twitter.com/ydotYDoXFI
— Variety (@Variety) February 5, 2024

As Snopes previously reported, Swift's past expressions of her political beliefs were somewhat the opposite of the idea of embracing false conspiracy theories about the 2020 U.S. presidential election. For example, she previously expressed views in opposition to the politics of former U.S. President Donald Trump and U.S. Sen. Marsha Blackburn of Tennessee – who are both Republicans – in the 2020 documentary "Miss Americana" and on her Instagram account.

original_rationales.main_rational: On Feb. 4, 2024, a user on X named il Donaldo Trumpo (@PapiTrumpo) – whose account mentions that it posts "a little bit of parody" – posted (archived) a video that appeared to show 14-time Grammy Award-winning recording artist Taylor Swift holding up a flag while walking the red carpet that read, "Trump Won, Democrats Cheated."
original_rationales.additional_rational1: While the video may have appeared obviously fake to some users, Elon Musk's social media platform X still showed a label that was displayed under the post that identified it as "manipulated media," adding a link to "find out more" and "stay informed."
original_rationales.additional_rational2: The original video posted by Variety on Feb. 4 showed Swift simply walking the red carpet and posing for photos, holding no flags or banners of any kind.
original_rationales.additional_rational3: As Snopes previously reported, Swift's past expressions of her political beliefs were somewhat the opposite of the idea of embracing false conspiracy theories about the 2020 U.S. presidential election.

summary_rationales.synthesized_rationale: The claim that Taylor Swift held up a flag at the 2024 Grammy Awards with the statement 'Trump Won, Democrats Cheated' is rated as 'Fake' due to multiple pieces of evidence pointing to the video being manipulated and false. Elon Musk's social media platform labeled the video as 'manipulated media' and provided a link for further information, indicating it may deceive or confuse people. The original video shared by Variety showed no such flag, and Swift's past political expressions contradict the idea of her supporting such conspiracy theories.

detailed_reasons.reason1: Elon Musk's platform labeled the video as 'manipulated media,' suggesting it was doctored or falsified in some way that could mislead viewers.
detailed_reasons.reason2: The lack of any flag or banner in the original video shared by Variety contradicts the claim that Taylor Swift was holding up a flag with the controversial statement at the event.
detailed_reasons.reason3: Swift's known political stance and past expressions, which include opposition to figures like Donald Trump, provide additional context that makes it unlikely for her to endorse or promote false conspiracy theories about election fraud.

evidence1:
Taylor Swift is gorgeous at the #Grammys. https://t.co/Imoq8xlJM9 pic.twitter.com/ydotYDoXFI
— Variety (@Variety) February 5, 2024

relationship_with_evidence.<reason2,evidence1>: Supportive. The evidence provided by Variety showing Taylor Swift at the Grammy Awards aligns with the rationale detail that there was no flag or banner in the original video shared by Variety, thus directly supporting the claim that Taylor Swift was not holding up a flag with the controversial statement.
